articles.headline: In North Carolina, Republicans Stung by Court Rulings Aim to Change the Judges
articles.snippet: Sweeping changes include introducing partisan ballots to judges’ races, the first state to do so in almost a century.
articles.abstract: Sweeping changes include introducing partisan ballots to judges’ races, the first state to do so in almost a century.
articles.lead_paragraph: RALEIGH, N.C. — Republicans with a firm grip on the North Carolina legislature — and, until January, the governor’s seat — enacted a conservative agenda in recent years, only to have a steady stream of laws affecting voting and legislative power rejected by the courts.

articles.headline: American Express C.E.O. Ken Chenault to Step Down
articles.snippet: Mr. Chenault, who has led American Express since 2001, is one of corporate America’s few black chief executives.
articles.abstract: Mr. Chenault, who has led American Express since 2001, is one of corporate America’s few black chief executives.
articles.lead_paragraph: Kenneth I. Chenault, one of the longest-serving executives in finance and one of corporate America’s few black top leaders, will retire next year as the chairman and chief executive of American Express.

articles.headline: Europe’s Fastest-Growing Economy Could Be Headed for Trouble
articles.snippet: Much of the growth in Romania is the product of a consumer bonanza, and economists worry that the good times cannot last given a lack of investment.
articles.abstract: Much of the growth in Romania is the product of a consumer bonanza, and economists worry that the good times cannot last given a lack of investment.
articles.lead_paragraph: BUCHAREST — Somewhere inside the vast shopping mall — beneath the roller coaster, across from the IMAX theater and down the corridor from the electronic casino — Anca Mariana Petculescu spotted an appealing pair of black leather boots.

articles.headline: China’s Reform Hopefuls Watch for Names. Only One May Matter.
articles.snippet: A leadership shuffle in the Communist Party could hint at its commitment to an economic overhaul, but Xi Jinping’s growing power may hinder that effort.
articles.abstract: A leadership shuffle in the Communist Party could hint at its commitment to an economic overhaul, but Xi Jinping’s growing power may hinder that effort.
articles.lead_paragraph: GUANGZHOU, China — A decade ago, this city in southeastern China had a reputation as one of the country’s grimmest, with smoggy skies, chronic traffic jams and streams so foul that they had to be paved over to contain the stench.

articles.headline: Senators Demand Online Ad Disclosures as Tech Lobby Mobilizes
articles.snippet: Tech has fought online ad regulations, but three senators will introduce a bipartisan bill to force the industry to disclose who buys political ads.
articles.abstract: Tech has fought online ad regulations, but three senators will introduce a bipartisan bill to force the industry to disclose who buys political ads.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator John McCain and two Democratic senators moved on Thursday to force Facebook, Google and other internet companies to disclose who is purchasing online political advertising, after revelations that Russian-linked operatives bought deceptive ads in the run-up to the 2016 election with no disclosure required.
articles.byline: By Kenneth P. Vogel and Cecilia Kang
